Find the closest R color

Source: R/jam-color.R
closestRcolor.Rd

Find the closest R color for a vector of colors

closestRcolor(
  x,
  colorSet = colors(),
  C_min = 20,
  showPalette = FALSE,
  colorModel = c("hcl", "LUV"),
  Hwt = 2,
  Cwt = 1,
  Lwt = 4,
  warpHue = TRUE,
  preset = "ryb",
  method = "maximum",
  returnType = c("color", "name", "match"),
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

x

character vector of colors, either in hex format or any valid color in R.

colorSet

vector of colors, by default includes the R colors provided by grDevices::colors() minus the "grey##" greyscale colors, however any vector of colors can be used, whether named or not.

showPalette

boolean indicating whether to display the input colors and resulting closest matching colors by using jamba::showColors().

colorModel

character color model to use, currently only using "hcl", though "rgb" and "ryb" were both tested and judged to perform less effectively.

Hwt, Cwt, Lwt

relative weights for each dimension of HCL colors, respectively.

warpHue

boolean indicating whether to perform the hue warp operation using h2hw() which improves the ability to match colors between orange and green.

returnType

character type of data to return: "color" will return the actual closest color; "name" will return the name of the closest color, or if the colorSet vector has no names, its values will be used; "match" will return an integer vector as an index to colors in colorSet.

verbose

logical whether to print verbose output

Details

This function is intended as a relatively efficient method to compare a set of colors to the named R colors provided by colors(). It has some distinction from similar methods, in that it uses HCL color space, unlike similar methods which may use RGB color space. It also prioritizes the color hue, then the luminance (visual brightness), then chroma (saturation). These weights can be adjusted if necessary although the default values appear to work fairly well.

See also

Other colorjam core: blend_colors(), colors_to_df(), group2colors(), rainbowJam(), sort_colors(), subset_colors()

Examples

closestRcolor(rainbowJam(12), showPalette=TRUE);

#>           #E90000           #FFB194           #FF8500           #C07E00 
#>            "red2"     "lightsalmon"     "darkorange1"         "orange3" 
#>           #00DBFF           #00A0FF           #001FFF           #CFCDFF 
#>      "turquoise2"      "dodgerblue"            "blue" "lightsteelblue2" 
#>           #BF91FF           #9D75EA           #FF64FF           #FF00E9 
#>   "mediumpurple1"   "mediumpurple2"         "orchid1"         "magenta"
